Introduction
I'm a biologist interested in the biodiversity of insects. My focus is primarily on true bugs (Hemiptera: Heteroptera) diversity and evolution, and I carry out faunistic, taxonomic and morphological research. I'm interested in such issues as the diversity and ultramorphology of sensory organs; morphology, taxonomy and systematics of Isometopinae and Cylapinae (Miridae); faunistics, distribution, biology and origin of heteropterofauna of Poland.

Projects

Projects (6)
Ultramorphology and diversification of the legs of true bugs from selected groups of the infraorder Cimicomorpha (Insecta: Hemiptera: Heteroptera) including habitat and trophic specialization.
Project
The goal of the project is to investigate the leg diversity of selected taxa of Cimicomorpha taking into account specific ultramorphological features used in taxonomy and phylogenetic analyses, and understanding the adaptative trends of the legs related to specific places of feeding and living.
View
Taxonomy, systematics & morphology of Cylapinae (Hemiptera: Heteroptera: Miridae)
Project
The project includes: describing new taxa, conducting detailed morphological studies and determining relations within Cylapinae, leading to an understanding of the evolutionary history of the subfamily.
View
Ultramorphology of sensory organs (sensilla) of true bugs (Hemiptera: Heteroptera)
Project
The main aim of the research is to describe in detail the sensory organs of selected Heteroptera groups.
View
